page.title: 02 Eastham - Dock Interview
page.content: The main feature of Eastham village is the {Queen Elizabeth Dock, though it is only 20 years old. Before it was built there were fields and ponds where the cattle and sheep used to graze. When the dock was built there were about 70% more ships coming in than nowadays. There has been a decline of dock workers coming from the village. { Dredgers}come into the dock about twice every year, though it depends upon the tide. They clear all the sewage and waste material from the dock, leaving it clear for the ships to come in. The largest ship coming into the dock fills up the whole of the dock length ways and its bow rests on the bank.
